gurmukhi: ikDO sUdR j`h q`h srb mih mhwrjX pwie pHrK hY ] ikDO cor Cwif Acyr ko gih srb drb AwkrK hY ]106]
transliteration: Kidhau Soodra Jahh Tahh Sarab Maib Mahaaraajya Paae Praharakh Hai|| Kidhau Chor Chhaad(i) Achor Ko Gadh Sarab Darab Aakarkh Hai||106||
translation: Somewhere the Brahmins will touch the feet of Shudras; somewhere the thief will be released and a pious man will be caught and his wealth will be looted.106.

gurmukhi: sB jg pwpI khU n jwpI AQpn QwpI dys idsM ] j`h q`h mqvwry BRmq BRmwry mq n auijXwry bwD irsM ]
transliteration: Sab Jag Paapi Kahoo Na Jaapiathapan Thaapi Des Disan|| Jahh Tahh Matvdare Bhramat Bhramdare Mat Na Ujiyaara Baadh Risan||
translation: The whole world will become sinful, there will be none performing austerities; in all countries the unestablishable things will be established; the jealous persons will roam hither and thither;

gurmukhi: pwpn rs rwqy durmq mwqy kumqn dwqy mq nykM ] j`h q`h auT DwvY icq llcwvY kCuhU n pwvY ibn eykM ]107]
transliteration: Paapan Ras Raate Durmat Maate Koumtan Daate Mat Nekan|| Jahh Tahh Outh Khaavai Vhit Lalchaavadkachh-boo Na Paavai Bin Ekan||107||
translation: Absorbed in sinful activities many sects, originators of vices, will come in vogue; because of the greed in their mind, the people will run here and there, but they will not realise anything.107.

gurmukhi: qij hir DrmM ghq kukrmM ibn pRB krmM sB BrmM ] lwgq nhI qMqRM Purq n mMqRM clq n jMqRM ibn mrmM ]
transliteration: Tah(i) Har(i) Dharman Gadat Koukarman Bin Prabh Karamannd Sabh Bharamannd|| Laagad Nahi Tantran Dhurat Na Mantran Chalat Na Jantran Bin Maramannd||
translation: Leaving the religion of the Lord, all will adopt evil ways, but without the actions related to the Lord everything will be useless; without understanding the secret, all the mantras, yantras and tantras will become useless;

gurmukhi: jp hY n dyvI AlK AByvI Awid AjyvI prm juDI ] kubuDn qn rwcy khq n swcy pRBih n jwcy qmk buDI ]108]
transliteration: Jap Hai Na Devi Alakh Abheviaadh Ajeviparam Judhee|| Koubudhan Tan Raache Kahat Na Saache Prabhah(i) Na Jaache Tamak Budhee||108||
translation: The people will not repeat the Name of the supremely heroic, unconquerable and incomprehensible goddess; they will remain absorbed in wicked deeds and morbid intellect, being devoid of the grace of the Lord.108.

gurmukhi: ApMfq gux mMfq subuD inKMfq dyKIAY ] CqRI br Drm Cwf Akrm Drm lyKIAY ]
transliteration: Apandat Goun Mandat Soubudh Nikhandat Dekheeai|| Chatribar Dharam Chhaad Akaram Dharam Lekheeai||
translation: The fools will become full of qualities and the wise will lose intellect; the Kshatriyas, leaving the superb dharma, will consider the vices as the real dharma;

gurmukhi: siq rhq pwp gHq kRu`D chq jwnIAY ] ADrm lIx AMg CIx kRoD pIx mwnIAY ]109]
transliteration: Sat(i) Rahat Paap Grahat Krudhh Chahat Jaaneeai|| Adharam Leen An Chhin Krodh Peen Maaneeai||109
translation: Devoid of truth, the sin and anger will receive respect and the individuals, absorbed in adharma and engrossed in anger will decline.109.

gurmukhi: kuqRIAn rs cwhI guxn n gRwhI jwnIAq ] s`q krm Cwf ky As`q krm mwnIAq ]
transliteration: Koutreean Ras Chaahigounan Na Graahijaaneeat|| Satt Karam Chhaad Ke Asatt Karam Maaneeat||
translation: Absorbed in the love of wicked women, the people will not adopt virtues; they will honour the wicked people, leaving aside the good conduct;

gurmukhi: rUp rihq jUp giHq pwp sihq dyKIAY ] Akrm lIn Drm CIn nwr ADIn pyKIAY ]110]
transliteration: Roop Rahit Joop Grahit Paap Sahit Dekheeai|| Akaram Leen Dharam Cheen Naar Adbeen Pekheeai||110||
translation: The groups of people, devoid of beauty, will be seen absorbed in sinful acts and will be under the impact of women devoid of dharma.110.

gurmukhi: Aiq pwpn qy jg Cwie rihE ] kCu buD bl Drm n jwq kihE ]
transliteration: At(i) Paapan Te Jag Chhaad Rahio|| Kachh(u) Budh Bal Dharam Na Naat Kahio||
translation: The sins have spread over the world and the intellect and religion have become powerless;

gurmukhi: ids bidsn ky jIA dyK sBY ] bhu pwp krm rq hY su AbY ]111]
transliteration: Dis Badisan Ke Jeea Dekh Sabhai|| Bahu Paap Karam Rat Hai Su Abai||111||
translation: The beings of various countries are engrossed in sinful acts.111.
